name: personal
trans: n. 人事消息栏；人称代名词
adj. 个人的；身体的；亲自的

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

name: tie
trans: n. 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
vi. 打结；不分胜负；被用带（或绳子等）系住
vt. 系；约束；打结；与…成平局

sentences.english: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.
sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points

detailed_translations.chinese: 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men

name: still
trans: conj. 仍然；但是；尽管如此
n. 寂静；剧照；蒸馏室
adj. 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的
adv. 仍然；更；静止地
vt. 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来
vi. 静止；平静；蒸馏

sentences.english: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
sentences.chinese: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。

sentences.english: Do you still have Julie’s phone number?
sentences.chinese: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

detailed_translations.english: up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment

detailed_translations.chinese: 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的
detailed_translations.english: not moving
a photograph of a scene from a film

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来

name: offer
trans: vt. 提供；出价；试图
n. 提议；出价；意图；录取通知书
vi. 提议；出现；献祭；求婚

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: addition
trans: n. 添加； 加法；增加物

sentences.english: This is a fine book; a worthy addition to the series.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本好书——是对这套丛书有价值的增补。

detailed_translations.chinese: 加， 加法； 附加物
detailed_translations.english: something that is added to something else, often in order to improve it

name: success
trans: n. 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: produce
trans: n. 农产品，产品
vt. 生产；引起；创作；生育，繁殖
vi. 生产，创作

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: expect
trans: vi. 期待；预期
vt. 期望；指望；认为；预料

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: cause
trans: n. 原因；事业；目标
vt. 引起；使遭受

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: state
trans: n. 国家；州；情形
adj. 国家的；州的；正式的
vt. 规定；声明；陈述

sentences.english: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个国家正处于战争状态。

sentences.english: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
sentences.chinese: 水有三种形态: 液态、气态和固态。

sentences.english: ...reform of the state social-security system.
sentences.chinese: …国家社会保障体制的改革。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies

name: manage
trans: vt. 管理；经营；控制；设法
vi. 处理；应付过去

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: directly
trans: conj. 一…就
adv. 直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: improve
trans: vt. 改善，增进；提高…的价值
vi. 增加；变得更好

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

name: wonder
trans: n. 惊奇；奇迹；惊愕
adj. 奇妙的；非凡的
vi. 怀疑；想知道；惊讶
vt. 怀疑；惊奇；对…感到惊讶

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准
adj. 现在的；出席的
vt. 提出；介绍；呈现；赠送
vi. 举枪瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: underline
trans: n. 下划线；下期节目预告
vt. 强调；在…下面划线；预告

sentences.english: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
sentences.chinese: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important

name: mislead
trans: vt. 误导；带错

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: complete
trans: adj. 完整的；完全的；彻底的
vt. 完成

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: lead
trans: n. 领导；铅；导线；榜样
vt. 领导；致使；引导；指挥
vi. 领导；导致；用水砣测深
adj. 带头的；最重要的

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: sensitive
trans: adj. 敏感的；感觉的； 灵敏的；感光的；易受伤害的；易受影响的
n. 敏感的人；有灵异能力的人

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: valuable
trans: n. 贵重物品
adj. 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的

name: courageous
trans: adj. 有胆量的，勇敢的

sentences.english: He was wrong, and courageous enough to admit it.
sentences.chinese: 他是错了，而且有勇气承认自己错了。

sentences.english: a courageous decision
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的决定

detailed_translations.english: brave

name: tend
trans: vt. 照料，照管
vi. 趋向，倾向；照料，照顾

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: matter
trans: n. 物质；事件
vi. 有关系；要紧

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: realise
trans: vt. 实现, 认识到, 体会到, 了解, 认清, 使显得逼真, 变卖财产为现钱

sentences.english: In the first half they realise their boss is exploiting them and begin to understand the theory of surplus value.
sentences.chinese: 在前半部，工人们认识到他们的老板是在剥削他们，开始了解剩余价值理论。

sentences.english: I hope that as time goes on we will realise that it is important for us to talk openly about Aids, because it is the only way to make it appear normal, like cancer.
sentences.chinese: 我希望随着时间的推移，人们将认识到公开谈论艾滋病是一件重要的事情，因为这是唯一一条使它成为像癌症一样的正常疾病的途径。

name: acceptable
trans: adj. 可接受的；合意的；可忍受的

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: consider
trans: vi. 考虑；认为；细想
vt. 考虑；认为；考虑到；细想

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: support
trans: n. 支持，维持；支援，供养；支持者，支撑物
vt. 支持，支撑，支援；扶持，帮助；赡养，供养

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: fit
trans: n. 合身；发作；痉挛
adj. 健康的；合适的；恰当的；准备好的
vt. 安装；使……适应；使……合身；与……相符
vi. 符合，配合；适合；合身

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: hang
trans: n. 悬挂；暂停，中止
vt. 悬挂，垂下；装饰；绞死；使悬而未决
vi. 悬着，垂下；被绞死；悬而不决

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员
adj. 专业的；职业的；职业性的

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: widen
trans: vt. 放宽
vi. 变宽

sentences.english: They’re widening the road.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在拓宽马路。

sentences.english: The river widens and splits.
sentences.chinese: 这条河有变宽的河段，也有分流的河段。

detailed_translations.english: to become wider, or to make something wider
to become wider, or to make something wider

name: require
trans: vt. 需要；要求；命令

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: creative
trans: adj. 创造性的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: deal
trans: n. 交易；（美）政策；待遇；份量
vi. 处理；讨论；对待；做生意
vt. 处理；给予；分配；发牌

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

name: popularity
trans: n. 普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: attend
trans: vi. 出席；致力于；照料；照顾
vt. 出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴

sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: weigh
trans: n. 权衡；称重量
vt. 权衡；考虑；称…重量
vi. 重量为…；具有重要性；成为…的重荷；起锚

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫， 压强
vt. 迫使；密封；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: credit
trans: n. 信用，信誉； 贷款；学分；信任；声望
vt. 相信，信任；把…归给，归功于；赞颂

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: visible
trans: n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目
adj. 明显的；看得见的；现有的；可得到的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: operate
trans: vi. 运转；动手术；起作用
vt. 操作；经营；引起；对…开刀

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: warn
trans: vt. 警告，提醒；通知
vi. 发出警告，发出预告

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: relate
trans: vt. 叙述；使…有联系
vi. 涉及；认同；符合；与…有某种联系

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: strength
trans: n. 力量；力气；兵力；长处

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: stress
trans: n. 压力；强调；紧张；重要性；重读
vt. 强调；使紧张；加压力于；用重音读

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

name: attack
trans: n. 攻击；抨击；疾病发作
vt. 攻击；抨击；动手干
vi. 攻击；腐蚀

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: determine
trans: v. （使）下决心，（使）做出决定
vt. 决定，确定；判定，判决；限定
vi. 确定；决定；判决，终止；了结，终止，结束

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵
adj. 志愿的
vt. 自愿
vi. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: lack
trans: vt. 缺乏；不足；没有；需要
vi. 缺乏；不足；没有
n. 缺乏；不足

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

name: equipment
trans: n. 设备，装备；器材

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: expense
trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支
vt. 向…收取费用
vi. 被花掉

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: deliver
trans: n. 投球
vt. 交付；发表；递送；释放；给予（打击）；给…接生
vi. 实现；传送；履行；投递

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

name: compare
trans: vi. 相比，匹敌；比较，区别；比拟（常与to连用）
vt. 比拟，喻为；构成
n. 比较

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

name: spread
trans: n. 传播；伸展
adj. 伸展的
vt. 传播，散布；展开；伸展；铺开
vi. 传播；伸展

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: seek
trans: vt. 寻求；寻找；探索；搜索
vi. 寻找；探索；搜索

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: distant
trans: adj. 遥远的；冷漠的；远隔的；不友好的，冷淡的

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: original
trans: n. 原件；原作；原物；原型
adj. 原始的；最初的；独创的；新颖的

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: impress
trans: n. 印象，印记；特征，痕迹
vi. 给人印象
vt. 盖印；强征；传送；给予某人深刻印象

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: remind
trans: vt. 提醒；使想起

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染
vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉
vt. 漫游；放牧；使并列；归类于；来回走动
vi. （在...内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: guidance
trans: n. 指导，引导；领导

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

name: avoid
trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: opportunity
trans: n. 时机，机会

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

name: emotion
trans: n. 情感；情绪

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: equal
trans: n. 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物
adj. 平等的；相等的；胜任的
vt. 等于；比得上

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: contain
trans: vi. 含有；自制
vt. 包含；控制；容纳；牵制（敌军）

sentences.english: The thieves stole a purse containing bank-notes.
sentences.chinese: 小偷们偷到了一个里面有钞票的钱包。

sentences.english: The museum contains a number of original artworks.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆藏有一些原创艺术品。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

name: hardly
trans: adv. 几乎不，简直不；刚刚

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；述说；预示；播报
vi. 宣布参加竞选；当播音员

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: reward
trans: n.  报酬；报答；酬谢
vt.  奖励；奖赏

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: desire
trans: n. 欲望；要求，心愿；性欲
vt. 想要；要求；希望得到…
vi. 渴望

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

name: promote
trans: vi. 成为王后或其他大于卒的子
vt. 促进；提升；推销；发扬

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: gather
trans: n. 聚集；衣褶；收获量
vt. 收集；收割；使…聚集；使…皱起
vi. 聚集；化脓；皱起

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: similarity
trans: n. 类似；相似点

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

name: advance
trans: n. 发展；前进；增长；预付款
adj. 预先的；先行的
vt. 提出；预付；使……前进；将……提前
vi. 前进；进展；上涨

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: percent
trans: n. 百分比，百分率；部分；百分数
adj. 百分之…的
adv. 以百分之…地

sentences.english: At the end of the day, add up the percent DVs.
sentences.chinese: 在一天结束后，把所有营养素的百分比加起来。

sentences.english: Machines are delivering up to only 25 percent of the fuel they combust.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转效率只能达到所耗燃料的百分之二十五。

sentences.english: But there are billions more people out there who are not in the top one percent, and they’re not in the top two or three either.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有十亿多的人不在其中，他们不在其中的百分之一，也不再其中的两百分之一或者三百分之一的其中。

name: character
trans: n. 性格，品质；特性；角色； 字符
vt. 印，刻；使具有特征

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: frighten
trans: vt. 使惊吓；吓唬…
vi. 害怕，惊恐

sentences.english: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.english: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.english: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid

name: accessible
trans: adj. 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: potential
trans: n. 潜能；可能性； 电势
adj. 潜在的；可能的；势的

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: review
trans: n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅
vt. 回顾；检查；复审
vi. 回顾；复习功课；写评论

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: replace
trans: vt. 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪吃的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: shock
trans: n. 休克；震惊；震动；打击；禾束堆
adj. 浓密的；蓬乱的
vt. 使休克；使震惊；使震动；使受电击；把…堆成禾束堆
vi. 感到震惊；受到震动；堆成禾束堆

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

name: judge
trans: vt. 判断；审判
n. 法官；裁判员
vi. 审判；判决

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: praise
trans: n. 赞扬；称赞；荣耀；崇拜
vt. 赞美，歌颂；表扬
vi. 赞美；赞扬

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

name: recover
trans: n. 还原至预备姿势
vt. 恢复；弥补；重新获得
vi. 恢复；胜诉；重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: confuse
trans: vt. 使混乱；使困惑

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: spot
trans: n. 地点；斑点
adj. 现场的；现货买卖的
vt. 认出；弄脏；用灯光照射
vi. 沾上污渍；满是斑点
adv. 准确地；恰好

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: attempt
trans: n. 企图，试图；攻击
vt. 企图，试图；尝试

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: available
trans: adj. 可获得的；可购得的；可找到的；有空的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: destruction
trans: n. 破坏，毁灭；摧毁

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["weapons of mass destruction"]}
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
sentences.chinese: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏

sentences.english: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏， 毁灭； 消灭
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

name: construct
trans: n. 构想，概念
vt. 建造，构造；创立

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: function
trans: n. 功能； 函数；职责；盛大的集会
vi. 运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: argument
trans: n. 论证；论据；争吵；内容提要

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: labor
trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩
vi. 劳动；努力；苦干
vt. 详细分析；使厌烦

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: private
trans: n. 列兵；二等兵
adj. 私人的；私有的；私下的

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: repeat
trans: n. 重复；副本
vi. 重做；重复发生
vt. 重复；复制；背诵

sentences.english: Can you repeat your question?
sentences.chinese: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？

sentences.english: Sorry - could you repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

sentences.english: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
sentences.chinese: 那不是我的错，我再说一遍，不是。

sentences.english: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance (= have the same thing happen again ) on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

detailed_translations.english: to say or write something again
an event that is very like something that happened before

name: spirit
trans: n. 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
vt. 鼓励；鼓舞；诱拐

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

name: suppose
trans: conj. 假使…结果会怎样
vt. 假设；认为；让（虚拟语气）；推想
vi. 猜想；料想

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: desert
trans: n. 沙漠；荒原；应得的赏罚
vt. 遗弃；放弃；逃跑
adj. 沙漠的；荒凉的；不毛的
vi. 遗弃；开小差；逃掉

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

name: exchange
trans: n. 交换；交流；交易所；兑换
vt. 交换；交易；兑换
vi. 交换；交易；兑换

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: fairly
trans: adv. 相当地；公平地；简直

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: regret
trans: n. 遗憾；抱歉；悲叹
vi. 感到后悔；感到抱歉
vt. 后悔；惋惜；哀悼

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: strict
trans: adj. 严格的；绝对的；精确的；详细的

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

name: fellow
trans: n. 家伙；朋友；同事；会员
adj. 同伴的，同事的；同道的
vt. 使…与另一个对等；使…与另一个匹敌

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

name: gradually
trans: adv. 逐步地；渐渐地

sentences.english: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。

sentences.english: Gradually, my ankle got better.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

detailed_translations.english: slowly, over a long period of time

name: belief
trans: n. 相信，信赖；信仰；教义

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

name: imagination
trans: n.  想象力；空想；幻想物

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: official
trans: adj. 官方的；正式的；公务的
n. 官员；公务员；高级职员

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述
vt. 认为；把…视为
vi. 解释；导致；报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
adj. 空闲的，有闲的
vi. 说服；被说服

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: figure
trans: n. 数字；人物；图形；价格；（人的）体形；画像
vt. 计算；认为；描绘；象征
vi. 计算；出现；扮演角色

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

name: seldom
trans: adv. 很少，不常

sentences.english: Karen had seldom seen him so angry.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦很少见他这么生气过。

sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science

trans: vt. 致力于；奉献

trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语

name: rarely

sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

name: hesitate

name: permit

vt. 许可；允许
vi. 许可；允许

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.

name: rapid

adj. 迅速的，急促的；飞快的；险峻的

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

name: colleague

sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

vi. 群集；做主人
