sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: decade
trans: n. 十年，十年期；十

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

name: sincere
trans: adj. 真诚的；诚挚的；真实的

sentences.english: Please accept my sincere apologies .
sentences.chinese: 请接受我真诚的道歉。

sentences.english: his sincere desire to find out the truth
sentences.chinese: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

detailed_translations.english: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

name: release
trans: n. 释放；发布；让与
vt. 释放；发射；让与；允许发表

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: constant
trans: n.  常数；恒量
adj. 不变的；恒定的；经常的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: conduct
trans: n. 进行；行为；实施
vi. 导电；带领
vt. 管理；引导；表现

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: overcome
trans: vt. 克服；胜过
vi. 克服；得胜

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: recycle
trans: n. 再生；再循环；重复利用
vt. 使再循环；使…重新利用
vi. 重复利用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: translate
trans: vt. 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
vi. 翻译

sentences.english: Poetry doesn’t usually translate well.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌通常都译不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
detailed_translations.english: to change written or spoken words into another language

name: fond
trans: adj. 喜欢的；温柔的；宠爱的

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: guard
trans: n. 守卫；警戒；护卫队；防护装置
vi. 警惕
vt. 保卫；监视

sentences.english: The Sergeant told Swift to guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 中士叫斯威夫特守着入口。

sentences.english: a lioness guarding her cubs
sentences.chinese: 守护着幼狮的母狮

sentences.english: There were two security guards on duty outside the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼外面有两名保安在值勤。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
someone whose job is to protect a place or person

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: pause
trans: n. 暂停；间歇
vi. 暂停，停顿，中止；踌躇

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

name: celebrate
trans: vt. 庆祝；举行；赞美；祝贺；宣告
vi. 庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

sentences.english: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

name: trick
trans: n. 诡计；恶作剧；窍门；花招；骗局；欺诈
adj. 特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的
vt. 欺骗；哄骗；装饰；打扮
vi. 哄骗；戏弄

sentences.english: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
sentences.chinese: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.english: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
sentences.chinese: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.english: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
sentences.chinese: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。

sentences.english: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to deceive someone
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；辩论会
vt. 辩论，争论，讨论
vi. 辩论，争论，讨论

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: delay
trans: n. 延期；耽搁；被耽搁或推迟的时间
vt. 延期；耽搁
vi. 延期；耽搁

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: deserve
trans: vi. 应受，应得
vt. 应受，应得

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: schedule
trans: n. 时间表；计划表；一览表
vt. 安排，计划；编制目录；将……列入计划表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: specific
trans: n. 特性；细节；特效药
adj. 特殊的，特定的；明确的；详细的； 具有特效的

sentences.english: games suitable for specific age groups
sentences.chinese: 适合特定年龄组的游戏

sentences.english: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

detailed_translations.english: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
particular details

name: concentrate
trans: n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液
vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集
vt. 集中；浓缩

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: quit
trans: n. 离开； 退出
vt. 离开；放弃；停止；使…解除
adj. 摆脱了…的；已经了结的
vi. 离开；辞职；停止

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: stare
trans: n. 凝视；注视
vt. 凝视，盯着看
vi. 凝视，盯着看；显眼

sentences.english: She sat there staring into space (= looking for a long time at nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 她坐在那里，出神地凝视前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored

name: sympathy
trans: n. 同情；慰问；赞同

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

name: alternative
trans: n. 二中择一；供替代的选择
adj. 供选择的；选择性的；交替的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: analyze
trans: vt. 对…进行分析，分解（等于analyse）

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面；方向；形势；外貌

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: disability
trans: n. 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件

sentences.english: Facilities for people with disabilities are still insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 供残疾人使用的设施仍然不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件
detailed_translations.english: A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life

name: admire
trans: vt. 钦佩；赞美
vi. 钦佩；称赞

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: adolescent
trans: n. 青少年
adj. 青春期的；未成熟的

sentences.english: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.
sentences.chinese: 一个青春期男孩应该有一个他能倾吐心声的成年人，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青春期的； 青少年的
detailed_translations.english: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
a young person, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult

name: faithfully
trans: adv. 忠实地；如实地；诚心诚意地；深信着地

sentences.english: He had served the family faithfully for 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 他已忠心耿耿地为这家人服务了40年。

sentences.english: Ann faithfully promised never to tell my secret.
sentences.chinese: 安信誓旦旦地保证决不把我的秘密说出去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忠实地；如实地；诚心诚意地；深信着地
detailed_translations.english: in a loyal way

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的
adv. 在先；在…以前

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: reliable
trans: n. 可靠的人
adj. 可靠的；可信赖的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: legal
trans: adj. 法律的；合法的；法定的；依照法律的

sentences.english: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。

sentences.english: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.english: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。

sentences.english: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
sentences.chinese: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

detailed_translations.english: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: symbol
trans: n. 象征；符号；标志

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: trap
trans: n. 陷阱；圈套； 存水湾
vt. 诱捕；使…受限制；使…陷入困境
vi. 设陷阱

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

name: apologize
trans: vi. 道歉；辩解；赔不是
vt. 道歉；谢罪；辩白

sentences.english: I’m so sorry, I do apologize.
sentences.chinese: 非常对不起，我真心道歉。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

name: mistaken
trans: adj. 错误的；弄错的；被误解的
v. 弄错（mistake的过去分词）

sentences.english: It can’t have been my car. You must be mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 那不可能是我的车，你一定弄错了。

sentences.english: I thought he said 12 o’clock, but I might have been mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 我以为他说的是12点，但我有可能弄错了。

sentences.english: We bought the rug in Turkey, if I’m not mistaken .
sentences.chinese: 如果我没弄错的话，我们是在土耳其买的这块地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误的；弄错的；被误解的
detailed_translations.english: if you are mistaken, you are wrong about something that you thought you knew or saw

name: vehicle
trans: n.  车辆；工具；交通工具；运载工具；传播媒介；媒介物

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: brief
trans: n. 摘要，简报；概要，诉书
adj. 简短的，简洁的；短暂的，草率的
vt. 简报，摘要；作…的提要

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: sharp
trans: n. 尖头；骗子；内行
adj. 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
vt. 磨快；把音调升高
adv. 急剧地；锐利地；突然地
vi. 打扮；升音演奏

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

sentences.english: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentences.chinese: 不要过桥，而是向左急转下到纤道上去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
detailed_translations.english: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sharp is also an adverb

name: ordinary
trans: adj. 普通的；平凡的；平常的
n. 普通；平常的人（或事）

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: ceremony
trans: n. 典礼，仪式；礼节，礼仪；客套，虚礼

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: maintain
trans: vt. 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: citizen
trans: n. 公民；市民；老百姓

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

name: violence
trans: n. 暴力；侵犯；激烈；歪曲

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: bid
trans: n. 出价；叫牌；努力争取
vi. 投标；吩咐
vt. 投标；出价；表示；吩咐

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: bitter
trans: n. 苦味；苦啤酒
adj. 苦的；痛苦的；尖刻的；充满仇恨的
vt. 使变苦
adv. 激烈地；严寒刺骨地

sentences.english: His photo stirred up bitter memories.
sentences.chinese: 他的照片勾起了痛苦的回忆。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very unhappy and upset

name: shame
trans: n. 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
vt. 使丢脸，使羞愧

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

name: bury
trans: vt. 埋葬；隐藏

sentences.english: Electric cables are buried beneath the streets.
sentences.chinese: 电缆埋在街道的下面。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone who has died in a  grave

detailed_translations.chinese: (Bury)人名；(法)比里；(英、西)伯里；(德、意、罗、波、捷、匈)布里；(俄)布雷

name: accurate
trans: adj. 精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: adapt
trans: vi. 适应
vt. 使适应；改编

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: regardless
trans: adj. 不管的；不顾的；不注意的
adv. 不顾后果地；不管怎样，无论如何；不惜费用地

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: commercial
trans: n. 商业广告
adj. 商业的；营利的；靠广告收入的

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: confidence
trans: n. 信心；信任；秘密
adj. （美）诈骗的；骗得信任的

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: amaze
trans: vt. 使吃惊

sentences.english: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: amuse
trans: vt. 娱乐；消遣；使发笑；使愉快

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: attach
trans: vi. 附加；附属；伴随
vt. 使依附；贴上；系上；使依恋

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: typical
trans: adj. 典型的；特有的；象征性的

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: negative
trans: adj.  负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的
n. 否定；负数； 底片
vt. 否定；拒绝

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: species
trans: n.  物种；种类
adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由
vt. 引起，惹起

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: cautious
trans: adj. 谨慎的；十分小心的

sentences.english: a cautious driver
sentences.chinese: 一位谨慎的司机

sentences.english: a cautious approach to the crisis
sentences.chinese: 处理危机的谨慎态度

sentences.english: The air-pollution board has reacted with cautious optimism to the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 空气污染委员会对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: careful to avoid danger or risks

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合
vt. 吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: political
trans: adj. 政治的；党派的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: convenient
trans: adj. 方便的；适当的；近便的；实用的

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

name: assess
trans: vt. 评定；估价；对…征税

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: astonish
trans: vt. 使惊讶

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品
vt. 保证；担保

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: decline
trans: n. 下降；衰退；斜面
vt. 谢绝；婉拒
vi. 下降；衰落；谢绝

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: background
trans: n. 背景；隐蔽的位置
adj. 背景的；发布背景材料的
vt. 作…的背景

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: block
trans: n. 块；街区；大厦；障碍物
adj. 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的
vt. 阻止；阻塞；限制；封盖

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻
adj. 紧急的；备用的

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: sink
trans: n. 水槽；洗涤槽；污水坑
vi. 下沉；消沉；渗透
vt. 使下沉；挖掘；使低落

sentences.english: Their motorboat struck a rock and began to sink.
sentences.chinese: 他们的摩托艇触了礁，开始下沉。

sentences.english: The kids watched as the coin sank to the bottom of the pool.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们看着那枚硬币沉到池底。

sentences.english: The heavy guns sank up to their barrels in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 这些沉重的大炮深陷在泥里，只露出炮管。

vi. 放毒，下毒

sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.chinese: 我每天早晨都去慢跑。

sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退

to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

name: accompany

sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

name: chief

adj. 首席的；主要的；主任的
adv. 主要地；首要地

sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.english: Safety is our chief concern .

sentences.english: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.

sentences.english: his chief rival for the job
sentences.chinese: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.chinese: 控方的主要证人

sentences.chinese: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

name: explode

vt. 使爆炸；爆炸；推翻

sentences.chinese: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.chinese: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: trend
trans: n. 趋势，倾向；走向
vt. 使…趋向
vi. 趋向，伸向

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: assistant
trans: n. 助手，助理，助教
adj. 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: bargain
trans: n. 交易；便宜货；契约
v. 讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: destination
trans: n. 目的地，终点

sentences.english: Ellis Island has become one of America's most popular tourist destinations.
sentences.chinese: 埃利斯岛已经成为美国最受欢迎的游览地之一。

detailed_translations.english: the place that someone or something is going to

name: adopt
trans: vi. 采取；过继
vt. 采取；接受；收养；正式通过

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: cheat
trans: n. 欺骗，作弊；骗子
vt. 欺骗；骗取
vi. 欺骗；作弊

sentences.english: The company engaged in a deliberate effort to cheat them out of their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司曾蓄意诈取他们的养老金。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cheats you out of something, they get it from you by behaving dishonestly
to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

name: cheque
trans: n. 支票

sentences.english: You could write her a cheque .
sentences.chinese: 你可以给她开张支票。

detailed_translations.english: a printed piece of paper that you write an amount of money on, sign, and use instead of money to pay for things

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品
vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: propose
trans: vi. 建议；求婚；打算
vt. 建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: manufacture
trans: n. 制造；产品；制造业
vt. 制造；加工；捏造
vi. 制造

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: crisis
trans: n. 危机；危险期；决定性时刻
adj. 危机的；用于处理危机的

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: foundation
trans: n. 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的
vt. 占用，拨出

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: approve
trans: vi. 批准；赞成；满意
vt. 批准；赞成；为…提供证据

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: astronaut
trans: n. 宇航员，航天员；太空旅行者

sentences.english: So why become an astronaut at all?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: grant
trans: n. 拨款； 授予物
vt. 授予；允许；承认
vi. 同意

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: routine
trans: n.  程序；日常工作；例行公事
adj. 日常的；例行的

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: distinguish
trans: vi. 区别，区分；辨别
vt. 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: absence
trans: n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在
detailed_translations.english: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌
adj. 最高的；最大值的
vt. 使达到最高点；使竖起
vi. 消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: temporary
trans: n. 临时工，临时雇员
adj. 暂时的，临时的

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: architect
trans: n. 建筑师
缔造者

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: universal
trans: n. 一般概念；普通性
adj. 普遍的；通用的；宇宙的；全世界的；全体的

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: grasp
trans: n. 抓住；理解；控制
vi. 抓
vt. 抓住；领会

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: decrease
trans: n. 减少，减小；减少量
vt. 减少，减小
vi. 减少，减小

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: define
trans: vt. 定义；使明确；规定

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

name: vast
trans: n. 浩瀚；广阔无垠的空间
adj. 广阔的；巨大的；大量的；巨额的

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据
vt. 目击；证明；为…作证
vi. 作证人

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: wrap
trans: n. 外套；围巾
vt. 包；缠绕；隐藏；掩护
vi. 包起来；缠绕；穿外衣

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: certificate
trans: n. 证书；执照，文凭
vt. 发给证明书；以证书形式授权给…；用证书批准

very firmly or closely

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: fortunate
trans: adj. 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: giant
trans: n. 巨人；伟人； 巨大的动物
adj. 巨大的；巨人般的

sentences.english: a giant electronics company
sentences.chinese: 一家电子产品巨头

sentences.english: a giant tortoise
sentences.chinese: 巨龟

detailed_translations.english: extremely big, and much bigger than other things of the same type

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨人，巨物；才智超群的人
detailed_translations.english: an extremely tall strong man, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: anniversary
trans: n. 周年纪念日

sentences.english: Jack and Kim celebrated their twentieth wedding anniversary in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月，杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

name: undoubtedly
trans: adv. 确实地，毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: deed
trans: n. 行动；功绩；证书； 契据
vt. 立契转让

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

sentences.english: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
sentences.chinese: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝，她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据
detailed_translations.english: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

name: barely
trans: adv. 仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: rival
trans: n. 对手；竞争者
adj. 竞争的
vt. 与…竞争；比得上某人
vi. 竞争

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: salary
trans: n. 薪水
vt. 给...加薪；给...薪水

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风，暴风

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: demonstrate
trans: vt. 证明；展示；论证
vi. 示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: beneath
trans: prep. 在…之下
adv. 在下方

sentences.english: The top layer should now point down to the layer beneath.
sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.english: The fortress on the hill covered the harbour area beneath.
sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

detailed_translations.english: in or to a lower position than something, or directly under something

name: brilliant
trans: adj. 灿烂的，闪耀的；杰出的；有才气的；精彩的，绝妙的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: shortcoming
trans: n. 缺点；短处

sentences.english: Peter was painfully aware of his own shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 彼得痛苦地认识到了自己的短处。

detailed_translations.english: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be

name: optional
trans: adj. 可选择的，随意的
n. 选修科目

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

name: paradise
trans: n. 天堂
至福境地

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: calculate
trans: vt. 计算；预测；认为；打算
vi. 计算；以为；作打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: permanent
trans: n. 烫发（等于permanent wave）
adj. 永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: capture
trans: n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏
vt. 俘获；夺得；捕捉，拍摄,录制

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: keen
trans: adj. 敏锐的，敏捷的；渴望的；强烈的；热心的；锐利的
n. 痛哭，挽歌

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: pure
trans: adj. 纯的；纯粹的；纯洁的；清白的；纯理论的

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: pursue
trans: vi. 追赶；继续进行
vt. 继续；从事；追赶；纠缠

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: reform
trans: n. 改革，改良；改正
adj. 改革的；改革教会的
vt. 改革，革新；重新组成
vi. 重组；改过

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: clarify
trans: vt. 澄清；阐明
vi. 得到澄清；变得明晰；得到净化

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: subordinate
trans: n. 下属，下级；部属，属下
adj. 从属的；次要的
vt. 使……居下位；使……服从

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: swallow
trans: n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量
vt. 忍受；吞没
vi. 吞下；咽下

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户
vt. 使转移；调任
vi. 转让；转学；换车

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机； 触发器；制滑机
vt. 引发，引起；触发
vi. 松开扳柄

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: fasten
trans: vt. 使固定；集中于；扎牢；强加于
vi. 扣紧；抓住；集中注意力

sentences.english: ‘I’m going now,’ she said, fastening her coat.
sentences.chinese: “现在我要走了。”她一边说，一边扣上大衣。

sentences.english: Fasten your seat belt.
sentences.chinese: 请系好安全带。

detailed_translations.english: to join together the two sides of a coat, shirt, bag etc so that it is closed
to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed

name: fulfill
trans: vt. 履行；实现；满足；使结束（等于fulfil）

sentences.english: And that is why we can fulfill our destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们能实现我们的命运。

sentences.english: What important dream have you yet to realize and fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么重要的梦想还没有实现和完成？

name: arrest
trans: n. 逮捕；监禁
vt. 逮捕；阻止；吸引

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: I got arrested for careless driving.
sentences.chinese: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
sentences.chinese: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

detailed_translations.english: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

name: unbelievable
trans: adj. 难以置信的；不可信的

sentences.english: It is unbelievable, but I like that.
sentences.chinese: 这很难以置信，但是我喜欢它。

sentences.english: The photographer uses the moving of light and excellent camera technique to create this unbelievable photo.
sentences.chinese: 摄影师利用光的移动和高超的摄影技术创造出这难以置信的图像。

name: unconscious
trans: adj. 无意识的；失去知觉的；不省人事的；未发觉的

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

name: unforgettable
trans: adj. 难忘的

sentences.english: He created many unforgettable characters in his novels.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的小说中创造了很多令人难忘的人物。

sentences.english: He spent so many unforgettable days with them that he was loath to part with them.
sentences.chinese: 他与他们一起度过那么多难忘的日子， 他舍不得离开他们。

sentences.english: For this reason, many travelers choose to return again and again to the unforgettable "Land of Smiles".
sentences.chinese: 正因为如此，许多游客会一次又一次地回到那令人难忘的“微笑之国”。

detailed_translations.english: an unforgettable experience, sight etc affects you so strongly that you will never forget it, especially because it is particularly good or beautiful

name: valid
trans: adj. 有效的；有根据的；合法的；正当的

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: deadline
trans: n. 截止期限，最后期限

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原
vt. 恢复；修复；归还

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: immigrant
trans: n. 移民，侨民
adj. 移民的；迁入的

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手；反对者；敌手
adj. 对立的；敌对的

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

路面

vt. 使倾斜
